q: I had a tattoo recently. Can I donate blood?
a: If you had a tattoo in the last 3 months, donation may be deferred. Please check the specific waiting period in the eligibility rules.

q: How often can I donate whole blood?
a: Typical whole blood donation interval is 12 weeks. Check local policy documents for exact intervals.

q: What are the side effects after donating?
a: Common effects are light-headedness or bruising. Rest, hydrate, and follow aftercare instructions.

q: Can I donate if I took antibiotics?
a: Recent antibiotics may require a deferral depending on the condition and completion time. See policy for details.
